meanings.definition: A reed pen used for writing.
meanings.sent1: I used a calami to write a letter to my friend.
meanings.sent2: The author carefully selected a calami to sign the book.
meanings.sent3: The calami danced across the paper, leaving a trail of ink behind.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed effortlessly from the calami onto the parchment.
meanings.sent5: The calami whispered secrets as it glided over the page.

meanings.definition: The hollow stem of a feather or quill.
meanings.sent1: The calami of the feather was delicate and intricate.
meanings.sent2: She admired the craftsmanship of the calami in the antique quill.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the calami as a tiny telescope.
meanings.sent4: The calami of the quill held the essence of ancient stories.
meanings.sent5: The calami swirled with colors, like a rainbow captured in a stem.
